title: Spear
data:
{{version030}} {{weapon |name = Spear |weight = 5.0 |skill = Polearms |damage = 6 |accuracy = +4 |basedelay = 11 |mindelay = 5 at skill 12 |size = Little |hands = 1H |ranged = No }} {{flavour|A hunting weapon consisting of a wooden shaft with a pointed metal head fastened on one end. ---- "The halberd is inferior to the spear on the battlefield. With the spear you can take the initiative; the halberd is defensive. In the hands of one of two men of equal ability, the spear gives a little extra strength.
-Miyamoto Musashi, _The Book of Five Rings_, 1645.}} {{crawlquote|This weapon falls into the [[Polearms]] category. It is a one handed weapon.}} '''Spears''' are good starting weapons. They require little skill to reach [[minimum delay]], and as a Polearm, they can [[reach]] up to 2 tiles away. ==Strategy== Of the "simple" starting weapons, spears are the strongest against single targets. Because spears can reach, they get 1 free attack for every engagement, which usually makes up for the worse stats compared to [[mace]]s or [[falchion]]s. Polearms in general are great if you have some means of creating distance. Characters with fast [[movement]] speed can [[kiting|kite]] enemies. Players with [[summon]]s can attack behind their allies. Even if you didn't start with melee, you can probably get at least one spear off of a [[gnoll (monster)|gnoll]] pack in the early dungeon. At 0 skill, spears are outright better than [[whip]]s and [[short sword]]s (if you aren't stabbing). But unless you find a good [[brand]]ed or [[randart]] spear, you'll want to upgrade to a [[trident]] quickly. {| class="prettytable" style="border:none; margin:auto; padding:0; text-align: center" ! || Image |- | '''Mundane''' || [[File:Spear1.png]] |- | '''Magical''' || [[File:Spear2.png]] |- | '''Artifact''' || [[File:Spear3.png]] |- ! || [[Unrandart]]s |- | '''[[Wyrmbane]]''' || [[File:Wyrmbane.png]] |- | '''[[Force Lance (unrand)|Force Lance]]''' || [[File:Force lance (unrand).png]] |} ==History== *Prior to [[0.14]], spears were also considered [[Throwing]] weapons. *Prior to [[0.9]], spears had 7 base damage but lacked [[reaching]]. {{weapons}} [[Category:Polearms]]
